title: Managment and funding of research in the era of information society (eResearch)
segmentation: So we can start with the Mr Francy.
Damn sure he will have the content management in founding researcher in the area of information SoC.

He will introduce the activities of this linear research agency and two information tools secrets Slovenia current research, information system, and Corbis cooperate, cooperate online via graphics systems as easy, so the desk is.
Thank you very much, ladies and gentlemen.
It's my pleasure to present to you.
Some of the some of the.
Main focus is that we have in Slovenian research agency.
Of course, since you are most of you are not from research, I will not focus on on on the majority of the topics that we cover, but I will focused on the use of ICT in our work especially.
Specially how to avoid conflict of interest and how to use transparency to make.
To make.
Working of the agency.
Not just deficient, but ethical as well.
We are very happy that new papers of European Union stress both ICT policies as a major driver of Europe's economic and social modernization.
We have been talking about this a lot yesterday.
And of course, that knowledge and innovations are the primary tools in which growth stems from European brains.
So we're talking about the most important things.
Let's first some background on Slovenian research agency.
So what Slovenian research Agency, which was established six years ago?
Does is.
Uh.
Is looking at excellent and applicative research, promotion of it and of course, evaluation of project proposals and then funding of project.
Proposals.
Our institutional design is very compara bulto institutional designs all over Europe, so there ministris which which are strategic lever and then their operational level.
Our agency technological agency.
That's approximately the situation all over Europe.
In contrary to to the tradition of East Europe, where there was no intermediate level, which Dan which then has problems of.
Politics, Direct involvement in decision of who gets the project.
So this this type of institutional designs avoids.

Problem just to get a feeling of the money available for for science in Slovenia through Slovenian research agencies or the budget of last year was 180 million euros, which as you see there was the best increase in last.
Here.
It's five years in last 10 years.
The biggest increase and actually.
If if I can comment on yesterday's lecture of professor is equal when he was telling how one of the goals of also Europe for twenty 2023%, so the how to convince politicians to to give money.
We used his terminology so we calculate it and reset if we will have this kind of continuation of growth of investment in our individual achieve 3% in.
2195 and it was.
It was quite a convincing number which changed the situation and.
So last year and this year again, the government made really serious effort to to lower this this estimate.
Patient so few words on our evaluation system.
And I won't go into details but just just one thing.
Evaluation system is very important because of if it's sufficient then right projects are chosen.
If it's not sufficient than then not only it's less efficient but also researchers say it's not fair.
And if it's not fair, all kinds of practices appears which are not good for for the development of.
Certain part of SoC just let me illustrate with an example of how this evaluation system looks like.
So.

Once, what is this four years ago I was having coffee and it was just at the end of valuation procedure and one prominent professor who is who is also very close to two right part political right part comes by and he asked me did I get a project on project proposal calls so I said no and he said, well, it's.
You will.
You will have a job for maybe 2, three or four months more.
So just prepare to be replaced and I was continuing having the coffee and maybe 10 minutes after that another person comes again.
Professor but this time from the left part of political arena so key as did I get a project so I said no and he said well we will change.
The government will change and you will be the first one to replace.
So, so it's very important that you have a system which is not very discounts of influence.
Do not influence decisions and again not to go into details of the system.
We have met an evaluation of the previous system five years ago.
We compared the results with bibliometric results, and we compared, who were those who who received who obtained?
We're successful in project proposal call and we found out that.

In 2001 it was 50% of those which were which were successful were also those which were the best according to Blme Trickle criteria and then two years later it was 70% and then again a little bit change system again 70%.
So the difference of this 20%, it's actually the difference of conflicts of interest.
So if you make a system which is fair, you can actually measure the conflict of interest and.
We have published this.
This thing so, where does transparency comes comes in.
This story or information technology?
G. We have introduced several several measures of transparency, transparency of instruments, procedures, financial transparency.
Yesterday it was turn mentioned, followed the money.
I will explain this how we do this in Slovenia and transparency of results of research.
We strongly believe that I strongly believe that through transparency.
You can you can change the behavior of.
Of public sector completely.
Let me again illustrate the this.
This idea was an example.
10 years ago or so or more I was I was a Minister of Defense in Slovenia.
So after the first month's Chief of the Cabinet comes to me and says, we have a little a little problem.
So I ask him what kind of problem do we have?
Well, he said, I looked the orders of in the cabinet, and each month we order 70 bottles of whiskey.
So I said, is this only this month order or no?
No no.
He said they say this goes on for years every month.
I said 30 people in the Cabinet, 70 bottles of whiskey each month.
So the first thought was of course let's fire everybody.
Or the second was what kind of job do I have?
And then what we've done.
We made the list which we passed to the to the secretaries in the Cabinet.
On this list you have to write what?
What you'll order for for for this purpose is each month.
So everybody saw this this list, so it was transparent.
And as by miracle there was no whiskey on that list.
And actually in those two years where I was having this job, this procedure continued not a single whiskey, and I don't know if anybody knew that I have done anything.
I didn't tell anybody it didn't force anybody, but it's just the way how transparency works is if.
People know that others are looking what they're doing, then they behave like completely different.
So of course you cannot dysidea like that simple way, but but you can.
So on our website to how all the details on calls for proposals with all the documentation all in here in advance, which is a methodology how the procedure goes which were not made before.
So this is one of the ways how how to make it.
Transparency, other is followed the money.

So Slovenia has a good tradition of so called white books on financing for starting from 54 there were books every year published in 90 seven we put them on the Internet and few years ago we introduced the system.
So that's how it looks like on Internet.
The system where we have monthly financial overview.
So each month when agency gives the money to institutions to project leaders to all kinds of 7000 contracts that we have, it's all on Internet.
So before before the financing services at the institutions know how much money they have, it's already on Internet and the reason is that institutions like.
Tend to tend to somehow use the money for other purposes and at the end of the year where the project leaders ask where the money is, it's already gone.
So if we put this every month and after we are putting this every month, it became really reliable, reliable source and changed the way how, how, scientific institution.
Schwarcz in Slovenia.
Transparency of research results is very important.
Of course it's not just articles being published, but all the all the information on researchers on research organization on equipment and bibliography on their citations on full full text.
Play how we have it in Slovenia, secrets is the main system where you can get.
Got information on 800 research organizations certain thousand researchers 5003 search groups so you get all detailed information on abstracts on web pages.
And since it's connected to the agency, it's it's updated and it's accurate.
So it's one of the most reliable systems that we have and it's connected to.
To two copies, bibliographic system which has all Slovenian bibliography of last, last, last 20 years.
I don't know if the country that has that complete bibliography.
Insight and the reason why it's complete is because the agency users only.
Looks at the applications of only those that have their bibliography in this bibliographic system, so that's how the system is made that you that you have to have data inside.
And of course when people watch at each other at their result, the effect is the same as with this with.
OK this situation.

And Kobe's is one of the successful successful products of of Maryborough Institute for Information Sciences and with whom we work closely together an it's it's working in in regions in countries in our region, and we hope it will increase its use.
Of course, secrecy is connected to say.
Station index is maybe this is an interesting photo.
It's connected to also lately to videolectures.net which was mentioned yesterday.
So so now I see the camera, so the presentation is so video lectures are on presentations on video lectures.
Very very nice system which makes see Chris also so far at whenever scientists have a presentation on video lectures.
It's already connected to secret, so you can.
You can get you can get.

This connection digital library of Slovenia is the digital source of all Slovenian scientific journals with all full text and recently also with Reportes final reports of projects and program program proposals.
So it's it's a joint effort between National Library in.
And research agency.
The question is, using this transparency system, did we?
Heavy heavy man.
Have we noticed any any changes in output trends in Slovenia?
And of course it's not the place to discuss in details, but shortly the the answer is yes, we can notice.
After using this transparency system that that all kinds of scientific indicators have have our started to change with.
One of the greatest place in Europe.
So for example, if we looked at three indicators, one would be would be how many publications per million inhabitants of Slovenia was here in from 2004 to 2006.
Now it's already here like Austria is.
But if we look very Slovenia is publications divided by GDP or over GDP for research, it's quite on the top.
We hope that by increasing GDP for research, we will also stand the top with increased.

Quality the last slide looks just one of those indicators how the number of publication was grown has been growing, so here system copies was introduced as as tool which is obligatory for all scientists and slope of growth of publications has almost doubled.
So the same goal would be achieved.
So this was without any euro extra money or at that time.
Taller extra money and if we would use if you would make this kind of change just by adding money, it would.
It would be something like 100 million euros which would be needed to achieve that kind of result which was achieved solely solely by by by transparency instruments.
We have then looked at this from all angles.
It comes out that it's the same at universities, same at institutes.
We divided by money, so it's.
It's proven that it's only because of this effect.
Thank.
Very much.
Thank you Mr. Denson's.
Mr.

Dancer said that the transparency is very important in this research and development process, but if I set my opinion in Slovenia is too much talking about as one of the basic theory is the number of the publishing works.
I think for my opinion it should be the main criteria should be the number of business application of research.
I think we should talk much more about this.
Is this aspect.
We said that discussion will be at the end, so but nevertheless I can comment on this.
I didn't want to in the presentation to talk about all aspects.
As I mentioned I could talk on these aspects a lot.
I mentioned just what was measurable, so and it's not the case at all.
What you say?
But I will later on explain.
Thank you.
